pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.13: SP.1.443: Tattha kālayuttaṃ samullapantoti kālaṃ sallakkhetvā yadā na añño koci samīpena gacchati vā āgacchati vā tadā tadanurūpaṃ “kacci na ukkaṇṭhasi, na kilamasi, na chātāsī”tiādikaṃ gehassitaṃ kathaṃ kathento, “‘When they were able, they chatted’: having considered the occasion, whether anyone else was coming or going nearby, they spoke about worldly things, such as, ‘I hope you are not yearning, fed up, and craving.’”
